relevant_findings.general: Appears well and in NAD, sitting up in bed
relevant_findings.HEENT: PERRLA, EOMI, anicteric, MMM, OP dry
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: RRR, S1 and S2, no m/r/g
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, ND. TTP in RUQ to light palpation. Well healed surgical scar in midline
relevant_findings.neurological: Awake, alert and oriented. Moving all extremities

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Tenderness in LUQ and RUQ on exam. RUQ ultrasound showed CBD borderline dilated at 6 mm. Amylase and LFTs elevated. Troponin 7.8.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient initially presented with mid-epigastric abdominal pain described as a dull, aching sensation which persisted for 4 hours.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Not c/o any pain. Notably had left shoulder and arm burning pain 2 days PTA that resolved spontaneously.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial pain resolved; stable condition noted in MICU.
